content: @WG-async-sprint-planning time for sprint planning!
Let's start by updating the last sprint section
I'm adding a "Summary:" paragraph to each section, I'd appreciate if people could fill it in with a sentence or paragraph summarizing anything that happened last sprint
for the newsletter :)
also, leave a :wave: above to let me know you're here
I'm sorry @tmandry that I never get this straight, but: You want us to start by updating the text under 2022-01-20, right?
oh yes, that's where the link points. okay.
yes
@triagebot end-topic when you're ready to move on to retrospective

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.
Sprint retrospective
Any thoughts / observations / insights about the last sprint?

FYI: I'll be having less time available than last year to dedicate to wg-async, so I'll be trying harder to get other people involved as I really want to see async iter land in 2022. This past sprint I couldn't make forward progress due to personal time constraints.
I’m happier having identified smaller chunks of work to check off today, rather than hoping the whole kabob would be done in the sprint
For async fundamentals the goals all turned out to be way too ambitious and we didn't check any of them, but I still feel like we made a fair amount of progress
I managed to make at least some progress on each of my goals. Generator drop tracking has a lot of lingering work that I didn't plan for though.
I was also on vacation we didn't get to make one of our regular meetings on monday, so that factored in
@triagebot end-topic

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.

tmandry said:

I was also on vacation we didn't get to make one of our regular meetings on monday, so that factored in

This probably isn't the forum to discuss this, but I've been wondering if it might make sense to tweak the Monday meeting some, and make it more complimentary with this one.
I'm certainly open to that. Start a Zulip thread?
Assign polish issues
Project Board
@triagebot end-topic

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.
Okay, I think we can move on
Upcoming sprint goals
Same as before, we'll update this in the doc and then I'll paste them
@eholk the "better-backtrace" repo isn't open source yet right?

Yoshua Wuyts [he/they] said:

eholk the "better-backtrace" repo isn't open source yet right?

Oops, fixed.
@eholk better-backtrace, does that inter-related with mw’s crashdump debugging work? It sounds there could be overlap based on the names alone
or, no, this is more of a post-processing cleanup approach?

pnkfelix said:

eholk better-backtrace, does that inter-related with mw’s crashdump debugging work? It sounds there could be overlap based on the names alone

Not really, this is more about formatting the dumps you get from RUST_BACKTRACE=1, but doesn't really interact with the debugger at all.
I’ll follow-up with @eholk offline, okay.
@Esteban Küber should you have a goal related to soliciting volunteer assistance?
since it sounds like your solicitation-via-tweet worked wonders this week. lol
As in that I shouldn't have included it?
or, oh, did I miss that?
ah, great minds thing alike, and ours too ^_^'
publish call for contribution with mentorship offer
Ah, this: "Publish call for contribution with mentorship offer” is yours?
yes
okay. Add your name. :)
added :)
@triagebot end-topic

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.

Async fundamentals

  • [ ] (tmandry) Open RFC PR for overconstrained impls
  • [ ] (nikomatsakis) Write another blog post for dyn proposal
  • [ ] (nikomatsakis/tmandry) Update RPITIT RFC to be re-opened
  • [ ] (yosh) Survey methods of context passing in other languages (e.g. implicits, etc.)

Async iteration

Goals:

  • [ ] (estebank) Publish blogpost for chances to proc macro
    • don't need sigils for disambiguation (for some cases)
    • alternatives for operation of ?
  • [ ] (estebank) Publish call for contribution with mentorship offer

Polish

Goals:

  • [ ] (eholk) Async stack traces
    - [ ] Improve better-backtrace handling and formatting of stack traces
    - [ ] Write a proposal for modifying libstd backtraces based on results.
  • [ ] (yosh) Publish blog post on select! {}'s concurrency semantics ("async concurrency III")

Issues:

  • [ ] (pnkfelix) Strange async use ...; compiler suggestion #87613
    - [x] finish extending AST representation
    - [x] add code to identify the injection points
    - [ ] update suggestion machinery

  • [ ] (pnkfelix) review or assist on: "Refine scopes around temporaries generated in local accesses" #92508

  • [ ] (tmandry) E0623 highlights wrong parameter in async fn #74256
    - [ ] Draft a PR to get the suggest_adding_lifetime_params suggestion firing on the async cases in the bug
  • [ ] (eholk) Dropped variables still included in generator type #57478
    - [ ] Merge #93180, possibly break it up some so that individual fixes can land separately.

Tooling

  • (pnkfelix) crashdump-debugging: identify + assist with task unrelated to async fn decoding Proof-of-Concept, Maybe one of the "fundamental debuginfo blockers".
Okay, that's what we have for the next sprint
@triagebot end-meeting I guess, unless there are follow-up questions / topics

Does anyone have something to bring up?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if you're ready to end the meeting.
Also, the Async Rust in 2022 blog post went out right before this meeting
I'm excited to make that vision real :)
I'll call the meeting now. Thanks everyone, and see you in two weeks!

Sorry I didn't make the meeting. I failed on both my goals, so have carried them over to this sprint. I did make decent progress towards an async read/write proposal and I spent a decent amount of time better understanding the issues with completion IO systems, so I actually feel like I made good progress, other than the deliverables :-)
